instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
power 
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL> stuck at 5 volt
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> cycling between 5v to 4.6 v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> cyc[U]ling 12v and then 0 volt[/U]
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> cycling between 2 v to 2.7 volt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
no liquid spill
no corrosion found
when  I  removed  <RESISTOR>R6979</RESISTOR>  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_R</SIGNAL> stable at 3.3 volt
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 5 volt constant
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12 volt constant

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message: not found any short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> line

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
Of course no short, if cycles 2-2.7V.
But you can compare diode mode reading with good board; that can give you an idea.

Check voltage and diode mode to ground on the small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.
Inspect audio board/flex for liquid signs.
Test the board disconnecting J6100.
